questionnaireInfo.text:
Welcome, future HPC power user.

The following questions will try to estimate your expertise in using the terminal, solving algorithmic problems with the programming language of your choice and will present you the acceptance test for starting the course.

Thank you for participating in the survey. If you encountered any problems or have further questions, please get in touch with me at steinbac@mpi-cbg.de !

The final part of the survey entails a small acceptance tests, that we'd like you to perform so that we know that you are ready to go:

Please use an ssh client of your choice on the laptop that you'll bring to the workshop and connect to madmax-falcon.mpi-cbg.de. Execute the command hostname (type hostname and press 'Enter') Send us the output of 2. to steinbac@mpi-cbg.de

question.text: Launching a terminal application on the computer I work with on a daily basis, is

category.label: something I do every day
something I do about once a month
something I do only if required with the help of google or a colleague
I never do

question.text: On the terminal, finding out how much space I have left on my computer will take me

category.label: just a second
some time for googling the right command
forever as I never use the terminal

question.text: You'd like to rename the directory you are currently working in with the terminal, you can do this task

category.label: with 1 or 2 strokes at the command line
I'll manage with the help of google or a colleague
no clue what to do

question.text: A collaborator sends you an executable program that you need to analyze his data. You download it and want to use it from the command line. This task appears

category.label: as easy as listing the current directories content.
doable for you with some help of google or a colleague.
to be a problem that I didn't know existed.

question.text: You notice that you accumulated quite some large files in a given directory. Using the terminal, you want to find the files that are larger than 10 MB and that you have created in the last 2 days. You can perform this task on command line

category.label: with a single command.
with some research on the web or asking a colleague.
with spinning up a file explorer and sorting the output as best as I could

question.text: In my daily job, I use programming

category.label: to solve the tasks given to me.
from time to time when I have to e.g. do some data analysis.
not at all.

question.text: In the programming language of my choice, create an array or list of 1000 elements

category.label: is something I constantly need to do.
is something I do from time to time.
is something I could do with the help of google or a colleague.
is something I do not know how to do.

question.text: When I program, creating applications that can be run on the command line

category.label: is something I do every day.
is something I can do with a bit of google or the help of a colleague.
is something I never did.
